lead_paragraph: Roger Federer will skip the opening round of next season’s Davis Cup, ruling out a showdown with Rafael Nadal, his Spanish rival. Switzerland and Spain will meet Feb. 9-11 in Geneva. The Swiss tennis federation said yesterday that Federer wanted to concentrate on defending his No. 1 ranking and winning Grand Slam events. The federation said it regretted Federer’s decision but understood his reasons.
